intro: Gymnosphaera glabra, commonly known as the smooth gymnosphaera, is a member of the family Cycadaceae and is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is a small, evergreen tree characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces cones, with male and female cones typically occurring on separate plants. Gymnosphaera glabra is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
